publicationstmt.publisher: Medical Historical Library, Harvey Cushing / John Hay Whitney Medical Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 02:00

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock collection

repository.corpname: Medical Historical Library, Harvey Cushing / John Hay Whitney Medical Library

did.abstract: The collection contains public health surveys by Hiscock and others; some correspondence; materials related to Hiscock's activities in Yale-in-China and the World Health Assembly; materials on Hiscock's awards; photographs and memorabilia on the dedication of the Ira V. Hiscock Library; and memorabilia that were to be assembled in scrapbooks, especially from the period after his retirement.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Donated to the Epidemiology and Public Health (EPH) Library by Margaret Hiscock Weatherly, Mount Laurel, N.J. Transferred to the Medical Historical Library, 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ira V. Hiscock collection, Historical Library, Cushing/Whitney Medical Library, Yale University, New Haven, CT

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related archival materials at Yale include Ira V. Hiscock scrapbook, Manuscript 20th cent, and Ira V. Hiscock scrapbook of articles relating to his career, Manuscript 20th cent, both in the Medical Historical Library; and Ira Vaughan Hiscock Papers (MS 1284), Manuscripts and Archives. The Medical Historical Library has a bound set of Hiscock's articles.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research. Yale does not own copyright.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ira V. Hiscock received a master's in public health from Yale in 1921 and served on the faculty of the Department of Public Health from 1920 on. He attained the rank of full professor in 1931 and became chairman of the department and Anna M. R. Lauder Professor in 1947, serving until his retirement in 1960. He was active in a large number of organizations and especially known for his work directing health surveys and in strengthening community public health organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: 1. Health surveys and related materials. 2. Other Hiscock materials. 3. Supplement, 2016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains public health surveys, mostly in mimeograph form, by Hiscock, as well as related surveys collected by Hiscock; speeches; some correspondence; materials related to Hiscock's work as a trustee of the Yale-in-China Association; materials related to his role as a member of the U.S. delegation to the World Health Assembly in 1958, and materials that were to be assembled in scrapbooks, especially from the period after his retirement. The supplement includes, among other items, correspondence of Philip E. Nelbach on public health in Westport; clippings on a community survey of the Greater Hartford area in 1948; mimeographs on polio in Connecticut ca. 1959; materials on Hiscock's awards; correspondence of Hiscock after his retirement with Edward R. DeLouise, Director of Public Health in New Haven; and photographs from the dedication of the Ira V. Hiscock Library (former EPH Library).

did.unittitle: Health surveys and related materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hiscock was asked to head or consult on many health surveys of cities, counties, and states across the United States. These reports contained data on mortality and morbidity, and examined the accomplishments and effectiveness of the various local organizations and institutions that served the health of the public. Some of the surveys in this series are by Hiscock. Others are related surveys that he collected. Many of the surveys were sponsored by such organizations as the Milbank Memorial Fund, the Commonwealth Fund, or the American Public Health Association. See also surveys in Box 8.

did.unittitle: Hawaii
Hawaii population statistics for 1910 and 1920
Ira V. Hiscock, "The Medical Care and Protection of Children in the Territory of Hawaii"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typescript of presentation from the White House Conference on Child Health and Protection, Medical Service Section, as prepared for publication. 94 numbered leaves plus maps.

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock, "A Survey of Public Health Activities in Honolulu, Hawaii: Includes Official and Voluntary Agencies, Under the Auspices of the Chamber of Commerce"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carbon of typescript, 227 pages. "With the cooperation of the Committee of Administrative Practice of the American Public Health Association."

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock, "Public Health in Military Government in Hawaii"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carbon of typescript, 51 leaves, including some printed pages. "For Part II of Volume of the Surgeon General on History of Preventive Medicine in World War II..." Hiscock was the author of Public Health in Hawaii. Report of health survey in 1950 ... under the auspices of the Oahu health council, inc., with the cooperation of the Board of health, Territory of Hawaii, and Survey advisory groups on Hawaii, Kauai, Maui, Molokai and Oahu [Honolulu, 1950].

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock, "Public Health in Honolulu: Report of a Health Inventory"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 74 mimeographed leaves. Report undertaken "under the auspices of the Oahu Health Council, Inc." Hiscock, having retired from Yale in 1960, was Carnegie Visiting Professor of Public Health, University of Hawaii in 1960.

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock, Draft public health inventories of the Big Island, Kauai, Lanai, Maui, and Molokai
Ira V. Hiscock, "Public Health in Hawaii: Report of a Health Inventory in 1960"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 51 mimeographed leaves. Conducted "under the auspices of the Oahu Health Council."

did.unittitle: Other materials related to Hiscock and Hawaii
Hiscock Lectures, University of Hawaii

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ira V. Hiscock Annual Lectureship, University of Hawaii, presented by Ira V. Hiscock, 1963 (including a long introduction by the President of the Oahu Health Council on Hiscock's accomplishments) ; Ira V. Hiscock Lecture, University of Hawaii, 1982, presented by Dorothy Nyswander.

did.unittitle: Robert H. White, et al, "Public Health Education Program: Report on Progress and Plans, Submitted to the Planning Committee, June 22, 1936"
did.materialspec: Mimeographed typescript, 36 leaves. Mention is made on p. 34 of Ira Hiscock who was hired as Public Health Education Consultant in 1934, and on p, 35 of Dr. H. H. Walker, from the Department of Public Health at Yale, who was made available to teach public health education at the University of Tennessee.

did.unittitle: "Malaria in Our Community: A Study of a Malaria Education Study in an Elementary School"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: By the Tennessee Valley Authority. Introduction by E. L. Bishop, M.D., Director of Health, Tennessee Valley Authority. The report was written by teachers participating in the project in a school in rural north Alabama. Mimeographed typescript, 14 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mimeographed typescript, 11 leaves. Text marked up and additional handwritten notes on lined paper, presumably by Ira Hiscock. Included is a handwritten note from E. L. Bishop to Hiscock asking for his comments.

did.unittitle: Ohio
W. F. Walker, Carl E. Buck, Ira V. Hiscock, and Homer N. Calver, Report of a Study of the Ohio Public Health Association

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "For the Committee on Administrative Practices." Mimeographed typescript, various paginations, published by the American Public Health Association. Inserted is a loose carbon of a letter from Howard W. Green to W. W. Charters, Bureau of Educational Research, Ohio State University, commenting on the report.

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock, James A. Hamilton, Albert L. Burgdorf, et al., Part I - Public Health: Health and Hospital Study of Dayton and Montgomery County

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Conducted under the auspices of the Chamber of Commerce, the Community Chest Association, the Metropolitan Health Council, Montgomery County Medical Society, and the Citizens Sponsoring Committee. Mimeographed typescript, 84 leaves.

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock, James A. Hamilton, Albert L. Burgdorf, et al, Public Health in Dayton and Montgomery County: Report of a Health and Hospital Study

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Conducted under the auspices of the Citizens Sponsoring Committee for Health and Hospital Study of Dayton and Montgomery County, Ohio." Carbon of a typescript, 134 leaves.

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock, et al., Public Health in Stark County, Ohio: A Survey of Public Health in Alliance, Canton, Massillon and Stark County, Ohio

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Conducted under the auspices of the county Survey Committee for the Year 1947 by staff representatives of Community Surveys Associated, New York." "Work copy - not for publication." Mimeographed typescript, 133 leaves. Photostat charts are loosely inserted on mortality from tuberculosis, infant mortality, mortality from cancer and other malignant tumors, mortality from diarrhea and enteritis, puerperal mortality, mortality from chronic diseases, mortality from diabetes, mortality from pneumonia, and mortality from all causes. All of these charts are for the years 1944-1946.

did.unittitle: Pamphlets, articles, and reports related to the Cleveland Health Museum

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hiscock appears to have collected these.

did.unittitle: Metropolitan Washington, D.C.
Ira V. Hiscock, [Health Survey of Washington, D.C.]: "Part I. Public Health Activities in Washington, D.C." "Part II. Community Relationships of Hospitals"
Charles F. Neergaard, "Program for Expansion of Hospital Facilities in the Metropolitan Area of Washington, D.C"
"Metropolitan Health and Hospital Survey": Remarks of C.-E. A. Winslow and of Claude V. Munger

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mimeographed typescripts plus handwritten drafts of Winslow's remarks and of his introduction to the survey. The survey was distributed in mimeographed form as Council of Social Agencies of the District of Columbia and Vicinity, Health and Hospital Survey of Metropolitan Washington, including District of Columbia, Alexandria, Va., Fairfax County, Va., Arlington County, Va., Montgomery County, Md., Prince George's County, Md. , by C.-E. A. Winslow, Ira V. Hiscock, and Claude W. Munger, 1946. A copy of the survey has been cataloged separately and is in the Historical Library.

did.unittitle: Supplementary material for the Health and Hospital Survey of Metropolitan Washington

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: See notes to previous folder for citation to the survey. Includes mimeographed "Supplement," August 1947, and "Limited Index," 1948.

did.unittitle: Baltimore
Ira V. Hiscock, James Hamilton, Hugh Leavell, and Ella L. Pensinger, "Survey of the Medical Care Advances of the Community Fund of Baltimore"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carbon copy typescript, 178 leaves, plus loose tables. This is likely a draft.

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock correspondence with Edwards A. Park concerning the Baltimore survey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Edwards A. Park was a pediatrician at Johns Hopkins University. He had chaired the Department of Pediatrics at Yale from 1922 to 1927.

did.unittitle: New York City
Ira V. Hiscock, "District Health Administration: A Study of Organization and Planning"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carbon typescript in a binder, various pagination. Foreward by John L. Rice, M.D., Commissioner of Health, New York City. The next folder has related loose material

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock, "District Health Administration: A Study of Organization and Planning," additional material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Additional chapters that go with the previous folder. Included is a letter from Victor Freeburg, Milbank Memorial Fund, to Hiscock, April 14, 1936, on the publication of the manuscript.

did.unittitle: Reports on East Harlem health services

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "The Maternity Service in the General Health Program," 1927; "Report of the Morbidity Service," ca. 1928; and "East Harlem Health Center," 1931. The latter includes a charts photographs of the outside of the health center. These reports are not by Hiscock.

did.unittitle: Other health surveys
Jeanette Bullis, "Public Health Study, Glen Cove, Long Island"
Philip S. Platt and Annette N. Platt, "A Health Survey and Appraisal of Orlando, Florida"
S. A. Douglass, "What Has Been Learned Concerning the Prevention and Control of Tuberculosis in a Rural County from Five Years of Health Demonstration Work in Cattaraugus [NY]"
W. L. Halverson, "Diphtheria Control in Los Angeles County"
Other Hiscock materials
Yale-in-China Association Trustees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ira Hiscock served as a trustee of the Yale-in-China Association from 1959 to 1972. Most of the material in the folder dates from 1971-1972. Contents include minutes, drafts of speeches, some correspondence, photographs of Hiscock's visit(s) to China, and reports on the new health services of the Chinese University of Hong Kong. Hiscock served as Chairman of Advisory Health Committee of Yale-in-China in 1972. Of interest is Hiscock's "confidential' draft, June 18, 1959, on trying to restart Yale-in-China after the Communist takeover by working with the New Asia College, which eventually became part of the Chinese University of Hong Kong.

did.unittitle: United States Delegation to the Tenth Anniversary Commemorative Session of the World Health Organization and the Eleventh World Health Assembly, Minneapolis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hiscock was a member of the American Delegation to the Tenth Anniversary Commemorative Session of the World Health Organization, held in Minneapolis Minnesota, May 26-28. This was followed by the Eleventh World Health Assembly, also in Minneapolis, May 28-June 14. Hiscock attended only through May 29. The folder contains handouts for members of the American Delegation and invitations to Hiscock to attend associated events.

did.unittitle: Materials on The Tenth Anniversary of W.H.O.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The session took place on May 26-28, 1958. Included are an address by the President of the Assembly and speeches by the chief delegates of a number of countries.

did.unittitle: W.H.O. materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets and mimeographed information about W.H.O. distributed at the Assembly.

did.unittitle: Materials related to Hiscock's courses at Yale
"Class Seminar Questions 1958" [on W.H.O.]
Thomas D. Dublin, "Looking Ahead in Epidemiology," Concluding Lecture, Survey Course in Epidemiology

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mimeographed typescript, 39 leaves, of invited lecture for Hiscock's Survey Course in Epidemiology (PH 101).

did.unittitle: A. M.-M. Payne, "Global Epidemiology Today," presented in Symposium, Perspectives in Epidemiology, Yale University
"The Life and Age of Man, edited by Ira Vaughan Hiscock"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typescript, 3 leaves, on stages of life. This piece relates to the Centennial of the American Public Health Association.

did.unittitle: Clippings on Hiscock's retirement and the appointment of his successor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hiscock retired as of January 1, 1960 and Anthony Monck-Mason Payne was appointed Anna M. R. Lauder Professor and Chairman of the reorganized Department of Epidemiology and Public Health.

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock Lecture, Yale University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Invitation, program and published version of the first Ira V. Hiscock Lecture at Yale, presented by Leona Baumgartner, 1966. Her presentation was "But What About the People," American Journal of Public Health 57(1967): 610-617.

did.unittitle: Presentations by C.-E. A. Winslow
Presentations by others

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of typescripts: Herman Biggs, "Famous Epidemics: Data in Regard to Certain Important Epidemics. For Illustrative Use in Connection with Lectures upon Public Health," ca. 1914; and Dorothy B. Nyswander, "Education for Health - Some Principles and Their Applications," 1956. These were possibly used in courses.

did.unittitle: Hiscock scrapbook materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Incoming letters and other materials taped into a notebook along with loose material added. The majority of the items are dated 1973. There is material on Isidore S. Falk being awarded the Sedgwick Memorial Medal from the American Association of Public Health in 1973. Also of note are a draft of a speech by Hiscock, "Case Study of Voluntarism, as Illustrated by the National Society for Prevention of Blindness," February 15, 1973.

did.unittitle: Hiscock scrapbook materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Similar to the previous file. Contains incoming letters, programs, photographs, newspaper clippings, and memorabilia. Of significance are a draft of a speech by Hiscock, "The New England Public Health Association of 1970: Highlights, Gaps, Bridges, and Ambitions," May 25, 1970; and a photocopy of a presentation by Hiscock, "The Setting and the Seal," New England Public Health Association, May 22-24, 1968. Most materials are from the 1970s.

did.unittitle: Hiscock's Awards

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All the paper-based awards were framed. The frames have been removed for archival storage.

did.unittitle: Yale University Hospital Administration Alumni Association

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Metal plaque mounted on wood.

did.unittitle: "To Ira V. Hiscock and the Faculty of Yale School of Public Health"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Metal plate attached to a wooden backing. From ten named individuals (seven M.D.s) from foreign countries.

did.unittitle: Honorary Degree in Medicine from the Connecticut State Medical Society
"Citation for Service to the World's Health"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From the American Association for World Health, Inc. and U.S. Committee for the World Health Organization.

did.unittitle: "Certificate of Appreciation" from the Mayor of New Haven, Richard C. Lee, and the Board of Health Commissioners
Honorary Member of the Connecticut Hospital Association
1953 Medal of the American Cancer Society, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Presented to Ira V. Hiscock upon the nomination of the Connecticut Division in recognition of his important contributions to the control of cancer."

did.unittitle: State of California, Department of State
C.-E. A. Winslow Award, Connecticut Public Health Association
Diploma from the Hygienists of Mexico

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Large hand-colored decorative parchment, 36.5 x 17 cm., signed in Mexico City by Dr. Jorge Perches Volasco, Dr. Miguel E. Bustamente, and Dr. Germain Selo de la Rea.

did.unittitle: Supplement added 2016

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The materials in the Supplement were transferred from the Ira V. Hiscock Library (EPH Library) of the Yale School of Public Health. Some were donated to the Ira V. Hiscock Library by Margaret H. Weatherly, Hiscock's daughter, in 1999. Others were donated by Edward DeLouise, Director of the New Haven Department of Public Health, upon his retirement in 1988. He donated "personal letters and materials that Dr. Hiscock sent me over the years." And some of the earlier materials appear to have come from the historical section of the EPH Library, and their provenance is unclear.

did.unittitle: Public health issues in Westport, Connecticut: Correspondence of Philip E. Nelbach

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence of Philip E. Nelbach (Yale College, 1939; M.P.H. Yale, 1938), Assistant Professor of Public Health in the Yale Department of Public Health, with Stanley H. Osborn, Commissioner of Health, State Department of Health, and with Harriet Y. (Mrs. Philip H.) Vivian, head of the Westport Committee for Better Public Health. These letters contain information on the politics of staffing for public health service. Part of the correspondence relates to a bill to form sanitary districts in the state.

did.unittitle: Newspaper clippings on a community survey of health and welfare agencies in the Greater Hartford area

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The survey was: Community Surveys, Inc., Crossroads (An Analytical Study of Health and Welfare services in Greater Hartford, Conn. Hartford: Greater Hartford Community Council, 1948. Hiscock and the Department of Public Health were responsible for the health part of the survey. The newspaper articles in this and the next two folders react to the publication of the survey and its recommendations.

did.unittitle: Newspaper clippings on a community survey of health and welfare agencies in the Greater Hartford Area: Recreation
Newspaper clippings on a community survey of health and welfare agencies in the Greater Hartford area: Family and Child Welfare, Public Health
Ira Hiscock, "Report on School Health in Taiwan"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "With special reference to participation by the American Bureau of Medical Aid to China." Mimeograph typescript, 6 pages.

did.unittitle: Poliomyelitis in Connecticut: Materials from the Connecticut State Board of Health

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article by Milo Rindge on polio in Connecticut in 1959, especially in New Haven, and mimeograph memoranda by the Connecticut State Department of Health on polio cases and vaccination.

did.unittitle: Field trip to Greenwich Hospital: Report and printed materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The author of the 4-page carbon copy report is not specified. With the report are brochures and forms provided by Greenwich Hospital and Greenwich Health Association.

did.unittitle: Memoranda on merging Public Health and Epidemiology at Yale

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "The Establishment of a Section of Epidemiology at Yale," "Working memorandum produced jointly by the Division of Preventive Medicine and Epidemiology and the Department of Public Health, Yale University, School of Medicine, Draft, 6 June 1957"; "A Proposal for Reorganization of the Program in the Field of Public Health in Yale University," April 7, 1959.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous correspondence of Ira V. Hiscock
Portrait of Ira V. Hiscock by Deane Keller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Invitation for the unveiling of the portrait, news release, and photograph of the portrait.

did.unittitle: "A Half Century of Public Health at Yale" and "After Thoughts"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The two documents may not be related but both are about the History of public health at Yale. Neither was dated but Hiscock much later guessed at dates. The second document was about how the building for Epidemiology and Public Health came about.

did.unittitle: "An Evening with Ira Hiscock," Connecticut Public Health Association

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From the papers of Edward De Louise, Department of Health, New Haven, who was an organizer of the event held on May 11, 1972.

did.unittitle: "Extracts of Annual Reports of the Dean in reference to Public Health, with personal note of Ira Hiscock"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains undated copies of pages on public health from the Dean's reports. Folder includes a photocopy of a 3-page written note by Ira Hiscock on his early career and the first years of the Department of Public Health.

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock Award of the New England Public Health Association in 1973

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Issue of the Yankee Crier , "Newsletter of the New England Public Health Association, vol. III, No. 1, Winter 1974, announcing the first Ira V. Hiscock Award given to Professor Clair E. Turner in May 1973. The newsletter contains a supplement: Ira V. Hiscock, "Power for Tomorrow's Health Care and Health Education," a summary of the May 1973 meeting.

did.unittitle: "The CUP of the Connecticut State Medical Society"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lunch talk given at the meeting of the C.S.M.S. House of Delegates, New Haven, December 13, 1973. Refers to the Society having conferred on him an honorary M.D. in April 1973. Article was published. See Box 8, Folder 21.

did.unittitle: Ira V. Hiscock Consumer Award, Connecticut Public Health Association

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From files of Edward DeLouise. Includes guidelines for the award, two copies of blank award certificates, a photograph of Ira Hiscock with the recipients of the C.-E. A. Winslow award and the first Ira V. Hiscock Award, and a press release about the winners of the 1979 awards with a snapshot of the winners with Edward DeLouise.

did.unittitle: Correspondence of Ira V. Hiscock with Edward De Louise

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These papers are from the files of Edward DeLouise. The folder contains mostly handwritten letters by Hiscock, who was by 1978 living in the Pine Run Community, Doylestown, Pennsylvania. The last letter, in 1987, is from Margaret Hiscock Weatherly saying that her father had died the year before. Included in one of the letters is a photograph of Mrs. Sucher and Mrs. [Anne] Winslow receiving the Winslow award in 1956, sent by Hiscock to DeLouise as an historical piece that might be given to an organization.

did.unittitle: C.-E. A. Winslow Centenary

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Illustrated pamphlet by the Department of Epidemiology and Public Health and copy of publication by Arthur J. Viseltear, "C.-E. A. Winslow Day: Proceedings of the June 3, 1977 Centenary Celebration," Yale Journal of Biology and Medicine , 50 (1977): 603-630

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous presentations by Ira V. Hiscock

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Five presentations: "Florence Nightingale's Contributions to Public Health," at the Annual Florence Nightingale Service, Norwalk, May 19, 1940; "Whose Job Is It," Annual Meeting of the Oahu Society for Crippled Children and Adults, October 20, 1960; "Health and Medical Care of Children and Youth -- Who Cares?" at Hawaii's White House Conference on Children and Youth, November 17, 1960: Connecticut's Heritage in Health," as President of the Connecticut Public Health Association, October 14, 1973; "Unsung Health Heroes in Connecticut," March 31, 1974. Also, timeline of public health achievements, April 1974.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous articles by Ira V. Hiscock
Miscellaneous clippings
Articles by Arthur J. Viseltear on the history of public health at Yale
Scrapbook of photographs at the opening celebration of the Ira V. Hiscock Library, Department of Epidemiology and Public Heath

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the program of the ceremony, signatures of attendees, photographs, and a separate handwritten key to the photographs.

did.unittitle: Additional copies of photos from the opening of the Ira V. Hiscock Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also contains a photo of Ira V. Hiscock, Edward DeLouise, Director of Health, New Haven, and Mayor Frank Logue, New Haven.
